questions.text: A _____ is a data structure that contains a set of related data elements that are stored and processed together.
questions.explanation: A record groups related data elements into one structure, representing a single instance of an entity.

questions.text: In data flow diagrams, which of the following may have two outputs but no input?
questions.explanation: A spontaneous generation process in a DFD produces data flows without receiving any input, which is logically impossible.

questions.text: A combination of fields that uniquely and minimally identify a particular member of an entity is known as a _____.
questions.explanation: A candidate key is a minimal set of attributes that can uniquely identify an entity instance.

questions.text: A field of an entity that has the potential to serve as a primary key can best be described as a _____ key.
questions.explanation: Candidate keys are attributes that can potentially serve as a primary key due to their uniqueness.

questions.text: Which of the following best relates to ensuring referential integrity in a database table?
questions.explanation: A foreign key maintains referential integrity by linking records in one table to valid entries in another.

questions.text: In a data flow diagram (DFD), verifying the number of PPE items received for COVID-19 is an example of a(n) _____.
questions.explanation: A process transforms input data into output, such as verifying quantities received.

questions.text: In a data flow diagram (DFD), 'Print a report' of the PPE received can best be described as an example of a(n) _____.
questions.explanation: ‘Print a report’ represents a process that produces output data from stored or input information.

questions.text: In a data flow diagram (DFD), a printed report of PPE received can best be described as a(n) _____.
questions.explanation: The printed report represents data leaving the system, which is classified as a data flow.

questions.text: Using Gane and Sarson naming conventions, ESSENTIAL WORKERS in a data flow diagram (DFD) is an example of a(n) _____.
questions.explanation: External entities, such as ESSENTIAL WORKERS, interact with the system and exchange data.

questions.text: In terms of data flow diagrams, which of the following best describes a SINK?
questions.explanation: A sink is an external entity that receives data from the system but does not provide input back.

questions.text: In terms of data flow diagrams, which of the following best describes a TERMINATOR?
questions.explanation: A terminator represents an external entity that interacts with the system as a source or sink of data.

questions.text: In terms of data flow diagrams, which of the following can best be described as a SOURCE?
questions.explanation: A source is an external entity that supplies data to the system.

questions.text: Analysts often use decision tables to describe a(n) _____ and ensure that they have considered all possible situations.
questions.explanation: Decision tables help define the logic and outcomes of processes by mapping conditions and actions.

questions.text: Following structured English rules ensures that _____ descriptions are understandable to the users.
questions.explanation: Structured English simplifies process descriptions using clear, structured logic for user comprehension.

questions.text: In data flow diagrams, which of the following produces the same results as a decision tree?
questions.explanation: Decision tables and decision trees both represent conditional logic, with tables showing it in tabular form.
